cards.name: Servant of Volrath
cards.text: When Servant of Volrath leaves the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
cards.flavor:
"Volrath is a harsh master. My reflection is a constant reminder of that."
—Greven il-Vec
cards.originalText: If Servant of Volrath leaves play, sacrifice a creature.

cards.name: Skyshroud Vampire
cards.text:
Flying
Discard a creature card: Skyshroud Vampire gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"If it tastes one drop of elvish blood I will cast it from the shroud to see it burn."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
cards.originalText:
Flying
Choose and discard a creature card: Skyshroud Vampire gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Souldrinker
cards.text: Pay 3 life: Put a +1/+1 counter on Souldrinker.
cards.flavor: Don't drink and thrive.
cards.originalText: Pay 3 life: Put a +1/+1 counter on Souldrinker.

cards.name: Spinal Graft
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"This one has not screamed enough to show effective implantation. Kill it."
—Volrath
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
If enchanted creature is the target of a spell or ability, destroy that creature. The creature cannot be regenerated this turn.

cards.name: Armor Sliver
cards.text: All Sliver creatures have "{2}: This creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn."
cards.flavor:
Hanna: "We must learn how they protect each other."
Mirri: "After they've done trying to kill us, all right?"

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: Each Sliver gains "{2}: This creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn."

cards.name: Benthic Behemoth
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor:
"Deep devourer   concealed in darkhome
Shrouded it seeks   all becomes fodder
Once we swam   alone and asea
But no more."
—Rootwater Saga
cards.originalText: Islandwalk (If defending player controls any islands, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Capsize
cards.text:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
Buyback {3} (You may pay an additional {3} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Return target permanent to owner's hand.

cards.name: Chill
cards.text: Red spells cost {2} more to cast.
cards.flavor:
"Temper, temper."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.originalText: Red spells cost an additional {2} to play.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.flavor:
"It was probably a lousy spell in the first place."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.originalText: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Dismiss
cards.text:
Counter target spell.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"There is nothing you can do that I cannot simply deny."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.originalText:
Counter target spell. 
Draw a card.

cards.name: Dream Cache
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand both on top of your library or both on the bottom of your library.
cards.flavor:
"The sanctity of poverty is an invention of the rich."
—Starke
cards.originalText: Draw three cards. Choose two cards from your hand and put both on either the top or the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Duplicity
cards.text:
When Duplicity enters the battlefield, exile the top five cards of your library face down.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile all cards from your hand face down. If you do, put all other cards you own exiled with Duplicity into your hand.
At the beginning of your end step, discard a card.
When you lose control of Duplicity, put all cards exiled with Duplicity into their owner's graveyard.

rulings.text: The cards are face down all the time. You can't look at them. This applies even to cards from your hand that got swapped out. You have to remember what they were if you care.
For a time the last ability triggered when Duplicity left the battlefield. It has been restored to triggering when you lose control of Duplicity.
Taking control of another player's Duplicity will trigger the ability that causes the cards they exiled to be put into their owner's graveyard.

cards.originalText:
When Duplicity comes into play, put the top five cards of your library face down on Duplicity.
During your upkeep, you may exchange all the cards in your hand for the cards on Duplicity.
At the end of your turn, choose and discard a card.
If you lose control of Duplicity, put all cards on it into owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Ertai's Meddling
cards.text:
X can't be 0.
Target spell's controller exiles it with X delay counters on it.
At the beginning of each of that player's upkeeps, if that card is exiled, remove a delay counter from it. If the card has no delay counters on it, the player puts it onto the stack as a copy of the original spell.

rulings.text: Note that a delayed spell that targets another spell won't resolve when it resolves since it will find that its target is no longer on the stack.
A targeted spell which is delayed will still succeed even if its target has phased out and back in again.

Ertai's Meddling can't be cast through any way that doesn't pay its mana cost. This is because the X in the Meddling's mana cost can't be 0, but effects that allow spells to be cast without paying their mana costs set X to 0.
If a copy of a spell (one that has no card representing it) is affected by Ertai's Meddling, the spell ceases to exist when exiled. It will not gain counters and will not be put back on the stack.
Once it is put back on the stack, it is a "new" spell again and can be countered or even targeted by another Ertai's Meddling.

If Ertai's Meddling is used to copy a spell being cast face down due to Morph ability, the spell will create a face up, 2/2, colorless, nameless creature with no text. This may be a little counter-intuitive, because you might expect the card to enter the battlefield face down like it would have when originally cast, but Ertai's Meddling copies only the original spell and not the entire card the spell represented.
This now exiles the spell as part of Ertai's Meddling's resolution, instead of waiting for the targeted spell to start resolving.

If the spell was cast using flashback, Ertai's Meddling will still exile it with delay counters on it. When the card is returned to the stack, it still "remembers" the flashback cost was originally paid. It'll be exiled when it resolves or otherwise leaves the stack.

If Ertai's Meddling is used to copy an arcane spell that had effects spliced onto it, it will create a spell with all of those effects. That spell's controller will not be able to splice additional effects onto the spell, since they did not re-cast the spell and instead simply put it back onto the stack.

Ertai's Meddling has the spell's controller put the spell back onto the stack; it does not have its controller cast the spell again. Anything that triggers off of casting spells, such as Contemplation , won't trigger. Simillarly, effects that count spells that are cast (like Rule of Law) or prevent spells from being cast (like Iona, Shield of Emeria) won't count or affect the copy that is put onto the stack since the copy wasn't cast.

cards.originalText:
When target spell is successfully cast, put X delay counters on it. X cannot be 0.
During each upkeep of that spell's caster, remove a delay counter from the spell. If the spell has no delay counters on it, it resolves.

cards.name: Escaped Shapeshifter
cards.text: As long as an opponent controls a creature with flying not named Escaped Shapeshifter, Escaped Shapeshifter has flying. The same is true for first strike, trample, and protection from any color.

rulings.text: In a multiplayer game, it works if any opponent controls creatures with the appropriate abilities.

cards.originalText: As long as your opponent controls any creatures with flying, Escaped Shapeshifter gains flying. The same is true for first strike, trample, and protection from any color.

cards.name: Fighting Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Two things are needed to survive the harsh skies of Rath: a thick hide and a thicker skull.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Fylamarid
cards.text:
Flying
Fylamarid can't be blocked by blue creatures.
{U}: Target creature becomes blue until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Fylamarid cannot be blocked by blue creatures.
{U}: Target creature is blue until end of turn.

cards.name: Gaseous Form
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"It's hard to hurt anyone when you're as transparent as your motives."
—Ertai, wizard adept

rulings.text: The enchanted creature can still attack and block.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature neither deals nor receives combat damage.

cards.name: Giant Crab
cards.text: {U}: Giant Crab gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: During the giant crabs' mating season, Skyshroud nights are filled with the clatter of their skirmishes.
cards.originalText: {U}: Until end of turn, Giant Crab cannot be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Horned Turtle
cards.flavor:
"So like men are they: a hardened shell with fragile flesh beneath."
—Selenia, dark angel

cards.name: Insight
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a green spell, you draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"We can fight with you or against you. After my day, I'd prefer the former."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Whenever target opponent successfully casts a green spell, draw a card.

cards.name: Interdict
cards.text:
Counter target activated ability from an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land. That permanent's activated abilities can't be activated this turn. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
Draw a card.

rulings.text: This card targets the ability, and not the permanent itself.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Counter target artifact, creature, enchantment, or land ability requiring an activation cost. Abilities of that permanent cannot be played again this turn. 
Draw a card.

cards.name: Intuition
cards.text: Search your library for three cards and reveal them. Target opponent chooses one. Put that card into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Targets an opponent. You choose an opponent during announcement. If you can't target an opponent, you can't cast this card.

cards.originalText: Search your library for any three cards and reveal them to target opponent. He or she chooses one. Put that card into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Legacy's Allure
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a treasure counter on Legacy's Allure.
Sacrifice Legacy's Allure: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of treasure counters on Legacy's Allure. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: The "power less than or equal to the number of treasure counters on this card" restriction is a targeting restriction and will be checked on resolution in addition to on announcement. If the creature's power changes to be greater than this before the effect resolves, then the Legacy's Allure triggered ability doesn't resolve, but the card stays in the graveyard.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, you may put a treasure counter on Legacy's Allure.
Sacrifice Legacy's Allure: Permanently gain control of target creature with power no greater than the number of treasure counters on Legacy's Allure.

cards.name: Legerdemain
cards.text: Exchange control of target artifact or creature and another target permanent that shares one of those types with it. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.flavor: Squee tucked the warm ball in his pocket and slipped a pebble in its place. 'Glok,' he mumbled, and hid.

rulings.text: You can't cast Legerdemain unless both targets share a type at that time. It will also check to make sure they share a type as it resolves. If they no longer do so, the exchange will not occur.

cards.originalText: Permanently exchange control of target artifact or creature for control of target permanent of the same type.

cards.name: Mana Severance
cards.text: Search your library for any number of land cards and exile them. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"And when this land is wasted, where will we go?"
—Thalakos lament
cards.originalText: Search your library for any number of land cards and remove them from the game. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Manta Riders
cards.text: {U}: Manta Riders gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Water is firmament to the finned."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.originalText: {U}: Manta Riders gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Mawcor
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Mawcor deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: From its maw comes neither word nor whisper—only wind.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Mawcor deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Meditate
cards.text: Draw four cards. You skip your next turn.
cards.flavor:
"Part of me believes that Barrin taught me meditation simply to shut me up."
—Ertai, wizard adept

rulings.text: You skip one turn as part of the effect.

cards.originalText: Skip your next turn: Draw four cards.

cards.name: Mnemonic Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "{2}, Sacrifice this permanent: Draw a card."
cards.flavor:
"A jigsaw puzzle that lives, breeds, and thinks."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: Each Sliver gains "{2}, Sacrifice this creature: Draw a card."

cards.name: Power Sink
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that player doesn't, they tap all lands with mana abilities they control and lose all unspent mana.

rulings.text: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not "tapped for mana". If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tapped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless its caster pays an additional {X}. If he or she does not, tap all mana-producing lands that player controls and remove all mana from his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Precognition
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top card of target opponent's library. If you do, you may put that card on the bottom of that player's library.
cards.flavor: A gleam like struggling sunlight penetrated Selenia's dark thoughts.
cards.originalText: During your upkeep, you may look at the top card of target opponent's library. You may then put that card on the bottom of his or her library.

cards.name: Propaganda
cards.text: Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature they control that's attacking you.
cards.flavor:
"You've failed Gerrard. You've failed the Legacy. You've failed yourself. I can do no more."
—Volrath, to Karn

rulings.text: The payment is made during the declare attackers step at the same time you are declaring the attacker.
If there is more than one Propaganda on the battlefield, the cost is cumulative.
If there are multiple attacks in a turn, then you have to pay for each attack.
Paying this cost is not an instant or any other kind of ability, it is an additional cost on the declaration of the attacker.
In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.
Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can't attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

cards.originalText: Each turn, each creature cannot attack you unless its controller pays an additional {2} for that creature.

cards.name: Rootwater Diver
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Rootwater Diver: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"Drop a dagger into the murky deep and the merfolk will cut your throat with it."
—Skyshroud saying
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Rootwater Diver: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Rootwater Hunter
cards.text: {T}: Rootwater Hunter deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"Bitter water   vicious wave
Shadow-cold shallows   root-made maze
Home's angry embrace."
—Rootwater Saga
cards.originalText: {T}: Rootwater Hunter deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Rootwater Matriarch
cards.text: {T}: Gain control of target creature for as long as that creature is enchanted.

rulings.text: Can target an unenchanted creature but has no effect on that creature.
A creature is "enchanted" if it has any Auras attached to it.
Unlike many similar creatures, Rootwater Matriarch untaps as normal during your untap step. Whether it's tapped or untapped has no bearing on the control-change effect.

The control effect applies so long as at least one Aura is attached to the creature, and will continue to apply even if Rootwater Matriarch has left the battlefield. The effect ends if at any time the creature has no Auras on it.

cards.originalText: {T}: Gain control of target creature as long as that creature has any enchantments on it.

cards.name: Rootwater Shaman
cards.text: You may cast Aura spells with enchant creature as though they had flash.
cards.flavor:
"Ugh! When did orcs and fish start having kids?"
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: You may play creature enchantments whenever you could play an instant.

cards.name: Sea Monster
cards.text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
cards.flavor: Water is life. Or perhaps it is just something to wash it down with.
cards.originalText: Sea Monster cannot attack unless defending player controls any islands.

cards.name: Shadow Rift
cards.text:
Target creature gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Draw a card.
cards.originalText:
Target creature gains shadow until end of turn. (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Draw a card.

cards.name: Shimmering Wings
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{U}: Return Shimmering Wings to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The brighter the wings, the deeper the impact crater.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gains flying.
{U}: Return Shimmering Wings to owner's hand.

cards.name: Skyshroud Condor
cards.text:
Cast this spell only if you've cast another spell this turn.
Flying
cards.flavor:
Condor's flight augurs sleepless night.
—Skyshroud proverb
cards.originalText:
Flying
You cannot play Skyshroud Condor unless you have successfully cast another spell this turn.

cards.name: Spell Blast
cards.text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)
cards.flavor: Call it the thinking mage's version of brute force.

rulings.text: Alternative costs, additional costs, cost increases, and cost reductions don't affect a spell's converted mana cost.

If the target spell has {X} in its mana cost, include the value chosen for that X when determining the value of the {X} in Spell Blast's mana cost. For example, if you wish to counter Volcanic Geyser (a spell with mana cost {X}{R}{R}) whose X is 7, you'll need to choose 9 for Spell Blast's X and pay {9}{U}.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell with total casting cost equal to X.

cards.name: Steal Enchantment
cards.text:
Enchant enchantment
You control enchanted enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"Why should I flatter another with imitation when I can satisfy myself through possession?"
—Ertai, wizard adept

rulings.text: When a player takes control of an enchantment, they do not get to change anything about the enchantment (such as what creature it is on, what choices it has or anything) at that time. They just become its controller.

cards.originalText: Gain control of enchanted enchantment

cards.name: Stinging Licid
cards.text:
{1}{U}, {T}: Stinging Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {U} to end this effect.
Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, Stinging Licid deals 2 damage to that creature's controller.

rulings.text: Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell failing to resolve for having no legal targets.

cards.originalText: {1}{U}, {T}: Stinging Licid loses this ability and becomes a creature enchantment that reads "Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, Stinging Licid deals 2 damage to that creature's controller" instead of a creature. Move Stinging Licid onto target creature. You may pay {U} to end this effect.

cards.name: Thalakos Dreamsower
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
You may choose not to untap Thalakos Dreamsower during your untap step.
Whenever Thalakos Dreamsower deals damage to an opponent, tap target creature. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Thalakos Dreamsower remains tapped.

rulings.text: Can be used on a creature that is already tapped.

cards.originalText:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
You may choose not to untap Thalakos Dreamsower during your untap phase.
If Thalakos Dreamsower damages any opponent, tap target creature. As long as Thalakos Dreamsower remains tapped, that creature does not untap during its controller's untap phase.

cards.name: Thalakos Mistfolk
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{U}: Put Thalakos Mistfolk on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"They are 'between' in every way."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary
cards.originalText:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{U}: Put Thalakos Mistfolk on top of owner's library.

cards.name: Thalakos Seer
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
When Thalakos Seer leaves the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"You see our world when you shut your eyes so tightly that tiny shapes float before them."
—Lyna, to Ertai
cards.originalText:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
If Thalakos Seer leaves play, draw a card.

cards.name: Thalakos Sentry
cards.text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
cards.flavor:
"Ill luck and poor geography caught the Thalakos between us and the Dauthi."
—Lyna, Soltari emissary
cards.originalText: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow)

cards.name: Time Ebb
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"Gone today, here tomorrow."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.originalText: Put target creature on top of owner's library.

cards.name: Time Warp
cards.text: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.
cards.flavor:
"Let's do it again!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

rulings.text: If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

cards.originalText: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Tradewind Rider
cards.text:
Flying
{T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: It is said that the wind will blow the world past if you wait long enough.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}, Tap two creatures you control: Return target permanent to owner's hand.

cards.name: Twitch
cards.text:
You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Battles are won in nuance.

rulings.text: If the targeted permanent is an illegal target by the time Twitch resolves, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You don't draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Unstable Shapeshifter
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, Unstable Shapeshifter becomes a copy of that creature, except it has this ability.
cards.flavor:
"In a world of untruths, the living lie rules."
—Oracle en-Vec

rulings.text: The copy effect is not targeted.

If a creature enters the battlefield that has some characteristic or ability set when it enters the battlefield, the copy does not get to make that choice (because it is not entering the battlefield). All values are zero and all checks for choices consider the choice not to have been made.
If the creature has power/toughness that is continuously recalculated, so does this copy of it.
When it changes "shape" to a new creature, any "enters the battlefield" abilities of the creature do not trigger.
The ability is granted as part of the copy effect, which means it will be removed by any effects that would remove abilities regardless of when the effect was created.

If an Unstable Shapeshifter is on the battlefield when another Unstable Shapeshifter enters the battlefield, the first one gets the second one's triggered ability, so will copy the next creature that enters the battlefield twice. It will only do so the next time a creature enters the battlefield, because the second "becomes a copy" effect to resolve will erase the extra triggered ability.

cards.originalText: Whenever any creature comes into play, Unstable Shapeshifter permanently becomes a copy of that creature and retains this ability.

cards.name: Volrath's Curse
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated. That creature's controller may sacrifice a permanent for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.
{1}{U}: Return Volrath's Curse to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: If the creature this card is on is sacrificed to this card, this card is put into the graveyard before the ability to unsummon it can be used.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature cannot attack, block, or play any ability requiring an activation cost. That creature's controller may sacrifice a permanent to ignore this ability until end of turn.
{1}{U}: Return Volrath's Curse to owner's hand.

cards.name: Whim of Volrath
cards.text:
Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another until end of turn. (For example, you may change "nonred creature" to "nongreen creature" or "plainswalk" to "swampwalk.")

rulings.text: Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.
You can't change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as "Island Fish Jasconius".
It can be used to change a land's type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn't change the name of any permanent.

cards.originalText:
Buyback {2} (You may pay an additional {2} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.)
Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word or basic land type with another until end of turn.

cards.name: Whispers of the Muse
cards.text:
Buyback {5} (You may pay an additional {5} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"I followed her song only to find it was a dirge."
—Crovax
cards.originalText:
Buyback {5} (You may pay an additional {5} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.) 
Draw a card.

cards.name: Wind Dancer
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Flying like a bird does not make you as free as one."
—Volrath
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Orim regarded Gerrard coolly. "You are like the drake," she said, her expression unchanging. "It works hard to maintain its position, but to us it seems to glide along effortlessly. You must do the same."
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Winged Sliver
cards.text: All Sliver creatures have flying.
cards.flavor:
"Everything around here has cut a deal with gravity."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers gain flying.

cards.name: Aluren
cards.text: Any player may cast creature spells with converted mana cost 3 or less without paying their mana cost and as though they had flash.
cards.flavor:
Squee bounced up and down. "I sees a horsey, an' a piggy, an' a—"
"If you don't shut up," hissed Mirri, "you'll see a kidney and a spleeny."

rulings.text: The mana cost of the creatures being cast is still the stated cost on the card, even though you did not pay the cost.
Aluren checks the actual printed cost on the creature card, and is not affected by things which allow you to cast the spell for less.
You can't choose to cast a creature as though it had flash via Aluren and still pay the mana cost. You either cast the creature normally, or via Aluren without paying the mana cost.
You can't use Aluren when casting a creature using another alternate means, such as the Morph ability.
If creature with X in its cost is cast this way, X can only be 0.

cards.originalText: Any player may play a creature card with total casting cost 3 or less whenever he or she could play an instant and without paying its casting cost.

cards.name: Apes of Rath
cards.text: Whenever Apes of Rath attacks, it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor: Monkeys three, monkeys through.
cards.originalText: If Apes of Rath attacks, it does not untap during your next untap phase.

cards.name: Bayou Dragonfly
cards.text: Flying; swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor:
"Like a sugar stick with wings!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand
cards.originalText: Flying; swampwalk (If defending player controls any swamps, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Broken Fall
cards.text: Return Broken Fall to its owner's hand: Regenerate target creature.
cards.flavor:
"I think I used up all my good luck and all my bad luck in the same fall."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Return Broken Fall to owner's hand: Regenerate target creature.

cards.name: Canopy Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
"We know our place in the cycle of life—and it is not as flies."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText: Canopy Spider can block creatures with flying.

cards.name: Charging Rhino
cards.text: Charging Rhino can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor:
"Is it wrong to go straight for what you want? Sneaking is for cats and goblins."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Charging Rhino cannot be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.name: Choke
cards.text: Islands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.flavor:
"One day we shall walk where once was water."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
cards.originalText: Islands do not untap during their controllers' untap phases.

cards.name: Crazed Armodon
cards.text: {G}: Crazed Armodon gets +3/+0 and gains trample until end of turn. Destroy Crazed Armodon at the beginning of the next end step. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: These are its last days. Mourning is over. Rage remains.
cards.originalText: {G}: Crazed Armodon gets +3/+0 and gains trample until end of turn. At end of turn, destroy Crazed Armodon. Use this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Dirtcowl Wurm
cards.text: Whenever an opponent plays a land, put a +1/+1 counter on Dirtcowl Wurm.
cards.flavor: Few of Rath's rivers follow a steady course, so many new channels are carved for them.

rulings.text: A spell or ability that tells a player to "put a land onto the battlefield" does not count as playing a land.

cards.originalText: Whenever any opponent plays a land, put a +1/+1 counter on Dirtcowl Wurm.

cards.name: Earthcraft
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Untap target basic land.
cards.flavor:
"The land gives up little, but we are masters of persuasion."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
cards.originalText: Tap an untapped creature you control: Untap target basic land.

cards.name: Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
cards.text:
Other Elf creatures have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
Other Elves have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"We have been patient. We have planned our attack. We are ready . . . now."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

rulings.text: This card only gives forestwalk to other Elf creatures. It gives shroud to all other Elf permanents, including non-creatures like Prowess of the Fair.

cards.originalText:
All Elves gain forestwalk. (If defending player controls any forests, those creatures are unblockable.)
Elves cannot be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Eladamri's Vineyard
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's precombat main phase, that player adds {G}{G}.
cards.flavor: The mushroom wine made Gerrard's head spin, and his stomach soon followed suit.

rulings.text: It will not trigger a second time in a turn, even if you cast a spell that gives you a third main phase.
Only the first main phase each turn is considered a precombat main phase, even if other combat phases are created (with Relentless Assault, for example).
This ability is not optional.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's main phase, add {G}{G} to that player's mana pool.

cards.name: Elven Warhounds
cards.text: Whenever Elven Warhounds becomes blocked by a creature, put that creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"If a creature is dumb enough to love you for leashing it, why would you want to follow its lead?"
—Mirri of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: If Elven Warhounds is blocked by any creature, put that creature on top of owner's library.

cards.name: Elvish Fury
cards.text:
Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell. If you do, put this card into your hand as it resolves.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Buyback {4} (You may pay an additional {4} when you play this spell. If you do, put it into your hand instead of your graveyard as part of the spell's effect.) 
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Flailing Drake
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Flailing Drake blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Too many choices will always distract a greedy beast.
cards.originalText:
Flying
If Flailing Drake blocks or is blocked by any creature, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Frog Tongue
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Frog Tongue enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: "But why can't I get one?" sniveled Squee. "All da bugs here got wings."

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText:
When Frog Tongue comes into play, draw a card. 
Enchanted creature can block creatures with flying.

cards.name: Fugitive Druid
cards.text: Whenever Fugitive Druid becomes the target of an Aura spell, you draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"If the druids are so devoted to their trees, I will carve them coffins from their precious heartwood."
—Volrath
cards.originalText: Whenever any player successfully casts an enchantment spell that targets Fugitive Druid, draw a card.

cards.name: Harrow
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Changing Rath's landscape is like tearing the scab from a wound.

rulings.text: The sacrifice of a land is part of the cost of casting Harrow. You can't pay this cost more than once to get a multiple effect.
The two lands do not count toward your normal one land you can play each turn.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a land: Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Heartwood Dryad
cards.text: Heartwood Dryad can block creatures with shadow as though Heartwood Dryad had shadow.
cards.flavor: To snare what lies between worlds takes the patient reach of trees.
cards.originalText: Heartwood Dryad can block creatures with shadow.

cards.name: Heartwood Giant
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Heartwood Giant deals 2 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Wind in the trees is soothing, but the same can't be said for trees on the wind.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a forest: Heartwood Giant deals 2 damage to target player.

cards.name: Heartwood Treefolk
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor:
"In all my years in Llanowar I never understood where trees fit in. They are revered by elves and watered on by dogs."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Forestwalk (If defending player controls any forests, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Horned Sliver
cards.text: All Sliver creatures have trample.
cards.flavor: A bristling wave of slivers broke against the Weatherlight's timbers.

rulings.text: Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers gain trample.

cards.name: Krakilin
cards.text:
Krakilin enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{G}: Regenerate Krakilin.
cards.flavor:
"A perfect reflection of its world: brutal, fetal, and lacking truth."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.originalText:
Krakilin comes into play with X +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{G}: Regenerate Krakilin.

cards.name: Mirri's Guile
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
cards.flavor: Hanna was astounded. Mirri read every leaf and wisp of breeze like a book of ancient lore.
cards.originalText: During your upkeep, you may look at the top three cards of your library and put them back in any order.

cards.name: Mongrel Pack
cards.text: When Mongrel Pack dies during combat, create four 1/1 green Hound creature tokens.

rulings.text: The Hound tokens are put onto the battlefield if it dies during the combat phase, even if it was not an attacker or blocker.

cards.originalText: If Mongrel Pack is put into any graveyard from play during combat, put four Hound tokens into play. Treat these tokens as 1/1 green creatures.

cards.name: Muscle Sliver
cards.text: All Sliver creatures get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: The air was filled with the cracks and snaps of flesh hardening as the new sliver joined the battle.

rulings.text: Yes, it does give the +1/+1 bonus to itself.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers get +1/+1.

cards.name: Natural Spring
cards.text: Target player gains 8 life.
cards.flavor: Mirri listened intently, even as Hanna held the healing water to her lips. Would the sound of the spring drown out the elves' approach?
cards.originalText: Target player gains 8 life.

cards.name: Nature's Revolt
cards.text: All lands are 2/2 creatures that are still lands.
cards.flavor:
"One day the land will don the semblance of flesh and challenge even the plowshare's blade."
—Oracle en-Vec

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: All lands are 2/2 creatures. (These creatures still count as lands.)

cards.name: Needle Storm
cards.text: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The rain is driven like nails.
cards.originalText: Needle Storm deals 4 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Nurturing Licid
cards.text:
{G}, {T}: Nurturing Licid loses this ability and becomes an Aura enchantment with enchant creature. Attach it to target creature. You may pay {G} to end this effect.
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.

rulings.text: Paying the cost to end the effect is a special action and can't be responded to.

If a spell that can target enchantments but not creatures (such as Clear) is cast targeting the Licid after it has become an enchantment, but the Licid's controller pays the cost, the Licid will no longer be an enchantment. This will result in the spell failing to resolve for having no legal targets.

cards.originalText: {G}, {T}: Nurturing Licid loses this ability and becomes a creature enchantment that reads "{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature" instead of a creature. Move Nurturing Licid onto target creature. You may pay {G} to end this effect.

cards.name: Overrun
cards.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"You want to know your enemy? Look at your feet while you trample him."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: Overrun affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

cards.originalText: All creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Pincher Beetles
cards.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"No fair! Since when does a bug get ta munch on me?"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand
cards.originalText: Pincher Beetles cannot be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Rath forces plants from its surface as one presses whey from cheese.

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card and put it into play, tapped. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Reality Anchor
cards.text:
Target creature loses shadow until end of turn.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"See how you like it."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.originalText:
Target creature loses shadow until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Reap
cards.text: Return up to X target cards from your graveyard to your hand, where X is the number of black permanents target opponent controls as you cast this spell.
cards.flavor:
"Let Volrath choke on his crop of hatred."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

rulings.text: This card has received errata so that it now targets a specific opponent.
The count of the number of black permanents the targeted opponent controls is done during announcement since it only affects target selection. It does not get recounted later.

cards.originalText: Return any number of target cards from your graveyard to your hand. You cannot choose more cards than the number of black permanents target opponent controls.

cards.name: Recycle
cards.text:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you play a card, draw a card.
Your maximum hand size is two.

rulings.text: Your maximum hand size is checked only during the cleanup step of your turn. At any other time, you may have any number of cards in hand.
Countering a spell that has been cast will not prevent you from drawing the card.

If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Spellbook (an artifact that says you have no maximum hand size) onto the battlefield and then put Recycle onto the battlefield, your maximum hand size will be two. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, you would have no maximum hand size.
To play a card means to play a land or to cast a spell that's a card (and not a copy of a card).

cards.originalText:
Skip your draw phase.
Whenever you play a card, draw a card.
During your discard phase, choose and discard all but two cards.

cards.name: Respite
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. You gain 1 life for each attacking creature.
cards.flavor: "If they board us we're finished," warned Orim. Crovax nodded. "And if they don't . . . what then?"
cards.originalText: Creatures deal no combat damage this turn. Gain 1 life for each attacking creature.

cards.name: Root Maze
cards.text: Artifacts and lands enter the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"We should step up repairs. I think the forest has plans for us."
—Crovax
cards.originalText: All artifacts and lands come into play tapped.

cards.name: Rootbreaker Wurm
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.flavor: As Gerrard made his escape, the wurm covered his flight by helping itself to three great mouthfuls of merfolk.
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Rootwalla
cards.text: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: If you try to sneak up on a rootwalla, you'll suddenly find yourself dealing with twice the lizard.

rulings.text: If this card's ability is activated by one player, then another player takes control of it on the same turn, the second player can't activate its ability that turn.

cards.originalText: {1}{G}: Rootwalla gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Use this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Scragnoth
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Protection from blue
cards.flavor: It possesses no intelligence, only counter-intelligence.

rulings.text: Side-effects of spells that would counter this card will still happen, because they happen even if the spell they're trying to counter can't be countered.
Spells can target Scragnoth and affect it while it is on the stack. Only effects that counter spells are ignored.
Spells with a side effect that only happens if a spell is countered do not have their side effect happen when the countering fails.

cards.originalText:
Protection from blue
While Scragnoth is being cast, it cannot be countered.

cards.name: Seeker of Skybreak
cards.text: {T}: Untap target creature.
cards.flavor:
"We shun them not for their dream but for their refusal to let such a noble dream die a noble death."
—Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

rulings.text: It can use its tap ability to untap itself.

cards.originalText: {T}: Untap target creature.
